content.rendered:
Sponsors & partners

Together, our sponsors and partners play an integral role in the advancement of BOLD. Their support is critical to our ongoing operation and mission.

  1. Home
  • Sponsors
  • Partners
  • iBOL
  • CBG
  • CCDB
  • NCBI
  • Naturalis
  • GBIF

Essential resources that empower
our mission

We are grateful for the generous contributions from our sponsors, whose funding and support enable us to continue developing and expanding the BOLD platform. Their commitment to innovation and scientific excellence drives our progress and ensures the sustainability of our initiatives.

Collaborating with leading
Institutions

BOLD supports the DNA barcoding programs of institutions around the world.  As a result, close partnerships play a crucial role in advancing our mission to scale DNA barcoding. Through collaboration with leading institutions, we enhance our capabilities in biodiversity research, data management, and conservation. Below are our most important partners.

International Barcode of Life

BOLD and the International Barcode of Life (iBOL) work hand in hand to advance global DNA barcoding initiatives. By uniting researchers from over 25 countries, iBOL fosters international cooperation that enhances BOLD’s mission. Our partnership with iBOL focuses on developing and promoting standardized DNA barcoding protocols, ensuring reliable and consistent data for biodiversity research worldwide.

01

Global Collaboration

iBOL unites researchers from over 25 countries, fostering international cooperation in DNA barcoding

02

Data Standardization

They lead efforts in developing and promoting standardized protocols for DNA barcoding.

Centre for Biodiversity Genomics

BOLD and the Centre for Biodiversity Genomics (CBG) have a critically synergistic relationship. While the CBG serves as host to the staff and hardware that support BOLD, the database and analytical tools provided through the BOLD platform enable the CBG’s mission to advance DNA-based systems for species identification and catalogue life on Earth. Together, they develop cutting-edge tools and techniques to push the boundaries of high-throughput DNA sequencing and analysis, enhancing capabilities in species diversity research and solidifying our leadership in biodiversity genomics.

01

Biodiversity Research

CBG excels in the advanced research and application of DNA-based species identification, contributing to our understanding of species diversity and evolution.

02

Leaders in Methodology

The CBG houses the Canadian Centre for DNA Barcoding, the premier lab for providing DNA barcode-based species identification services.

Canadian Centre for DNA Barcoding

In partnership with the Canadian Centre for DNA Barcoding (CCDB), BOLD benefits from CCDB’s extensive DNA barcode repository and educational outreach programs. Our collaboration supports global biodiversity studies and trains the next generation of researchers, strengthening the scientific community’s ability to conduct comprehensive biodiversity research.

01

Comprehensive Database

CCDB maintains an extensive repository of DNA barcodes, supporting global biodiversity studies.

02

Educational Outreach

They offer training programs and resources to educate researchers and the public on DNA barcoding.

National Center for Biotechnology Information

BOLD leverages the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI)’s robust data hosting and bioinformatics tools to extend the reach of DNA barcode data. Our partnership with NCBI ensures that data generated for DNA barcoding projects is well-supported and broadly discoverable, providing access to essential resources that widely reach the scientific community.

01

Data Hosting

NCBI hosts a vast collection of genetic data, providing essential resources for DNA barcoding projects.

02

Bioinformatics Tools

They offer a suite of bioinformatics tools for analyzing and interpreting genetic data.

Naturalis Biodiversity Center

BOLD partners with the Naturalis Biodiversity Center to utilize one of the world’s largest natural history collections to support species identification and biodiversity research. This collaboration enriches the global DNA barcode database and promotes public awareness and engagement in this endeavour through exhibitions and citizen science programs, fostering a deeper understanding of biodiversity. Naturalis also serves as an important hub for the European barcoding community by hosting the European BOLD mirror.

01

Museum Collections

Naturalis houses one of the largest natural history collections in the world, aiding in species identification and research.

02

Public Engagement

They engage the public through exhibitions and educational programs, promoting biodiversity awareness.

Global Biodiversity Information Facility

BOLD partners with the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) to enhance data accessibility and quality for biodiversity research and conservation efforts. GBIF aggregates biodiversity data from multiple sources, making it readily available for researchers worldwide, thereby supporting comprehensive and impactful biodiversity studies.

01

Data Aggregation

GBIF aggregates biodiversity data from multiple sources, making it accessible for research and conservation efforts.

02

Global Network

They facilitate a global network of data providers, enhancing the availability and quality of biodiversity information.
